OriginIntroduction_Default.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player can be seen in the pod, then it opens and they fall on the ground.
OriginIntroduction_Default.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player can be seen in the pod, then it opens and they fall on the ground.

OriginIntroduction_Default.text: CinematicNodeContext: |Player gets up ready to find a way out of the hells.|
OriginIntroduction_Default.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player gets up ready to find a way out of the hells.|

OriginIntroduction_Karlach.text: CinematicNodeContext: Wake up next to a mind flayer
OriginIntroduction_Karlach.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wake up next to a mind flayer

OriginIntroduction_Wyll.text: CinematicNodeContext: Wake up next to a mind flayer
OriginIntroduction_Wyll.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wake up next to a mind flayer

OriginIntroduction_Laezel.text: CinematicNodeContext: |Laezel is near the open hole in the nautiloid. Avernus can be seen through it.|
OriginIntroduction_Laezel.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Laezel is near the open hole in the nautiloid. Avernus can be seen through it.|

OriginIntroduction_Laezel.text: CinematicNodeContext: |She turns to find a way to leave the hells.|
OriginIntroduction_Laezel.context: CinematicNodeContext: |She turns to find a way to leave the hells.|

OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod2.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player can be seen in the pod, then it opens and they fall on the ground.
OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player can be seen in the pod, then it opens and they fall on the ground.

OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod2.text: CinematicNodeContext: |Player gets up ready to find a way out of the hells.|
OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod2.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player gets up ready to find a way out of the hells.|

OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod3.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player can be seen in the pod, then it opens and they fall on the ground.
OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player can be seen in the pod, then it opens and they fall on the ground.

OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod3.text: CinematicNodeContext: |Player gets up ready to find a way out of the hells.|
OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod3.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player gets up ready to find a way out of the hells.|

PAD_Start.speaker: Player
PAD_Start.text: We need a way out. Now.

session_synopses.OriginIntroduction_Default: Introductory cinematic in TUT for any avatar that's not Laezel, Wyll, Karlach or Shadowheart. Pod opens, players falls on the ground and gets up.
session_synopses.OriginIntroduction_Karlach: Introductory cinematic for Karlach in Tutorial that shows her being next to a dead mindflayer.
session_synopses.OriginIntroduction_Wyll: Introductory cinematic for Wyll in Tutorial that shows her being next to a dead mindflayer.
session_synopses.OriginIntroduction_Laezel: Introductory cinematic for Laezel in Tutorial that shows her like she was left in the CGI cinematic, with her being close to a hole in the nautiloid in avernus after having escaped from the pod she was in. She is exhausted but needs to push through to leave the hells.
session_synopses.OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod2: Introductory cinematic in TUT for any avatar that's not Laezel, Wyll, Karlach or Shadowheart. Pod opens, players falls on the ground and gets up. This dialog play on the second player occupying a default player pod.
session_synopses.OriginIntroduction_Default_Pod3: Introductory cinematic in TUT for any avatar that's not Laezel, Wyll, Karlach or Shadowheart. Pod opens, players falls on the ground and gets up.This dialog play on the third player occupying a default player pod.
session_synopses.PAD_Start: A VB between all starting players after they get up from the explosion in the pod room.

PAD_DeadImps.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadImps.text: Devilkin. Am I in the Hells?
PAD_DeadImps.context: NodeContext: lae'zel's line: gh'ath = ship. gah-ATH

PAD_NautiloidBook.speaker: Narrator
PAD_NautiloidBook.text: *A schematic of a nautiloid flashes into your mind. Nerves, sinews, as much living being as ship.*

PAD_MFBook.speaker: Narrator
PAD_MFBook.text: *A feeling penetrates your mind. An anomaly. One like ourselves, unconnected from the whole. Caution.*

BrainReader.speaker: Player
BrainReader.text: |There is no brain in the machine|

PAD_HistoryBook.speaker: Narrator
PAD_HistoryBook.text: *Faint images appear in your mind: a brain, a githyanki warrior, and centuries of darkness...*

session_synopses.PAD_BrainJarLoot: Picking up one of the special brain jars, for Slave Mind, Dark Mind and Our Mind respectively.
session_synopses.PAD_DeadImps: Player comments when seeing dead imps in the lab.
session_synopses.PAD_NautiloidBook: Player picks up a mind flayer record, with some lore they pick up that telepathically flashes through their eyes. Other records already talk about humans, elves, dwarves, goblins, mindflayer history...This one could be about the nautiloid itself
session_synopses.PAD_MFBook: Player picks up a mind flayer record, with some lore they pick up that telepathically flashes through their eyes. Other records already talk about humans, elves, dwarves, goblins, mindflayer history...This one could be about mindflayer abilities or any other relevant topic.
session_synopses.BrainReader: tarted by interacting with the device. Allows player to insert certain brains in it and read part of their contents. There are currently three brains that can be read. That of a Shar cleric that will reveal a hint on the acquisition of the box. A brain of an adventurer that reveals the location of a secret in WLD or SCL. And the brain of a mindflayer that has a tbd secret.
session_synopses.AD_DevourerVictim: The Intellect Devourer asking for help from a distance, as the player approaches, while it is still trapped in the skull.
session_synopses.PAD_AcidMawComment: Player interacts with a foreign object that seems to have a type of liquid in it.
session_synopses.PAD_HistoryBook: Player picks up a mind flayer record, which they cannot make out.

MindflayerTransformation.speaker: Player
MindflayerTransformation.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Player pulls a tentacle lever
~Pod prisoner starts to panic banging on the glass as the mechanism works
~The prisoner barfs up tentacles and becomes a mind flayer and becomes lethargic
MindflayerTransformation.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Player pulls a tentacle lever
~Pod prisoner starts to panic banging on the glass as the mechanism works
~The prisoner barfs up tentacles and becomes a mind flayer and becomes lethargic

MindflayerTransformation.speaker: Player
MindflayerTransformation.text: Place your hand on the console.

MindflayerTransformation.speaker: Narrator
MindflayerTransformation.text: *As you place your hand on the pod, you hear something: A presence connected to the pod, commanding the person inside to... change.*

MindflayerTransformation.speaker: Losiir
MindflayerTransformation.text: Infected by a ghaik tadpole, but changed at the pull of a lever? This cannot be. If we do not find our cure, this might well be our fate.

MindflayerTransformation.speaker: Lae'zel
MindflayerTransformation.text: Kaincha! Changed at the pull of a lever? How? If we are not purified, this may be our fate.

AD_AltGuide_Backtrack.speaker: Losiir
AD_AltGuide_Backtrack.text: There's no time to waste. We must get to the helm.

AD_LaezelBacktrack.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelBacktrack.text: There is no time to tarry.

PodMindflayer.speaker: Narrator
PodMindflayer.text: *The newborn mind flayer stares at you, weak and dazed.*
PodMindflayer.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Mindflayer looks at player outside of pod, then looks away

PAD_TransformationReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_TransformationReaction.text: We need to get out of here - before it's our turn.

PAD_TransformationReaction.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TransformationReaction.text: That could have been me, if you hadn't gotten me out of my pod...
PAD_TransformationReaction.context: NodeContext: Aghast, looking at a newborn mind flayer (realising how close a call she had while trapped in her own pod shortly beforehand)

session_synopses.PAD_OriginPod_Empty: One of the first ADs in the game. Player has crashlanded on the mind flayer ship and investigates other pods around them. These are empty - no one is inside. These lines will only appear when clicking on the pods of your fellow avatars (i.e. other people in multiplayer)
session_synopses.MindflayerTransformation: The player sees a lever transform someone into a mind flayer. This is unusual and shouldn't happen. Gith guide will be shocked by what they see.
session_synopses.AD_AltGuide_Backtrack: ADs from alt guide in tutprial
session_synopses.PAD_GenericNautiloidItem: Player touches a generic weird mind flayer item in the nautiloid
session_synopses.PAD_RestingStation: Player interacts for the first time with a resting station at the nautiloid. This is especially so that players who have full HP will understand what the resting station does.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelBacktrack: Lae'zel urges the player not to backtrack. She wants them to go forward to the helm, not mess around. Can be played throughout the tutorial.
session_synopses.PodMindflayer: A newly born mind flayer (still in its pod) stares at the player.
session_synopses.PAD_TransformationReaction: Player reaction to seeing the prisoner transform into a mind flayer after clicking on the first pod.

PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack.text: The ship won't be able to take another dragon attack. We need to get out before it's too late.

AD_LaezelAfterFight.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelAfterFight.text: You prove surprisingly adequate in battle.

AltGuide_Stairs.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_Stairs.text: Chaos beyond. We must feign that we are thralls like the others.

session_synopses.PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack: PAD in tutorial when crossing the imp room and a dragon attack with fire happens in the background. Player urges to keep going forward.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelAfterFight: Lae'zel tells player in the tutorial you should head to the helm.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterFight: Comment on how they should get to the helm. Triggered after the imp fight on the lower deck and if the gith guide is not there.
session_synopses.AltGuide_Stairs: cautions the player to blend in with the chaos on the upper deck to not get in trouble.

PAD_NervesReminder.speaker: Player
PAD_NervesReminder.text: Damn these imps - I need to reach the transponder.

AD_LaezelMindflayerFall.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelMindflayerFall.text: The ghaik has fallen. Once we escape, we are free.

AD_LaezelIgnoreCambion.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelIgnoreCambion.text: Ignore the devil! We must take the transponder.

Transponder.speaker: Narrator
Transponder.text: *The helm's alien transponder - you've made it in time.*
Transponder.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the transponder itself, a series of nerves waiting to be connected.

Transponder.text:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] connects control ganglion
Dragon presses up against nautiloid windshield
[Player] reacts to dragon pressing against windshield
Dragon breaths fire into pilot chamber
[Player] Reacts to dragon fire in pilot chamber
Connected control ganglions beging to vibrate out of the control
Connected control ganglions vibration idle lvl1
Dragon snaps at player
[Player] reacts to dragon snap
Transponder.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] connects control ganglion
Dragon presses up against nautiloid windshield
[Player] reacts to dragon pressing against windshield
Dragon breaths fire into pilot chamber
[Player] Reacts to dragon fire in pilot chamber
Connected control ganglions beging to vibrate out of the control
Connected control ganglions vibration idle lvl1
Dragon snaps at player
[Player] reacts to dragon snap

Transponder.text:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] looks up to see the new plane the nautiloid has shifted to
Connected control ganglions vibration idle lvl2
[Player] tumbles further aft from planeshift
Debris tumbles further aft from planeshift
[Player] tumbles fore from planeshift
Debris tumbles further fore from planeshift
Transponder.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] looks up to see the new plane the nautiloid has shifted to
Connected control ganglions vibration idle lvl2
[Player] tumbles further aft from planeshift
Debris tumbles further aft from planeshift
[Player] tumbles fore from planeshift
Debris tumbles further fore from planeshift

Transponder.text:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] catches themselves on control console
[Player] reaches control ganglions
Control Ganglions stop
Transponder.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] catches themselves on control console
[Player] reaches control ganglions
Control Ganglions stop

AD_AmbushDevil.speaker: 5e0dd3f6-ca0f-4acb-ae0a-076afb1fe907
AD_AmbushDevil.context: NodeContext: vee-KAX-oh-GAH. Battle cry shouted to lead a bunch of imps to attack a mindflayer

PAD_MindFlayerFall.speaker: Player
PAD_MindFlayerFall.text: Mind flayer's dead - the imps killed it.

AD_AltGuide_MindflayerFall.speaker: Losiir
AD_AltGuide_MindflayerFall.text: The ghaik is dead, praise Vlaakith.

MindflayerCall.speaker: Mind Flayer
MindflayerCall.text: InternalNodeContext: ~The player and Laezel walk into the Pilot Chamber to find a pitched battle playing out in front of them
MindflayerCall.context: InternalNodeContext: ~The player and Laezel walk into the Pilot Chamber to find a pitched battle playing out in front of them

MindflayerCall.text: CinematicNodeContext: ~A mind flayer extracts a cambion's brain before getting swarmed by imps
MindflayerCall.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~A mind flayer extracts a cambion's brain before getting swarmed by imps

AD_GreaterDevil.speaker: Commander Zhalk
AD_GreaterDevil.text: Throw their corpses in the Styx!

AD_ShadowheartRemindsNerves.speaker: Shadowheart
AD_ShadowheartRemindsNerves.text: Keep going! Get to the transponder!
AD_ShadowheartRemindsNerves.context: NodeContext: Urgent - one last effort so they can escape the crashing nautiloid

AD_BackUpCambion.speaker: Cambion, Cambion
AD_BackUpCambion.text: Stop the intruders! They must not escape!
AD_BackUpCambion.context: NodeContext: Urgently as the cambion joins battle with his comrades.

PAD_FirstWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstWarning.text: We need to get out of here - now.

PAD_PlayerOutsideHelm.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerOutsideHelm.text: Ship's going to buckle. I need to get to the helm.

AD_LaezelRemindsNerves.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelRemindsNerves.text: Forward, istik, before more dragons come!

session_synopses.PAD_NervesReminder: In combat: mind flayer, cambion and laezel are dead. Remind of reaching the nerves.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelMindflayerFall: The mind flayer has fallen in combat - player won't expect to fight it later. Lae'zel is releived, but the tension is still high as they try to escape from the Hells.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelIgnoreCambion: Players attack cambion, Lae'zel reminds them to not waste time.
session_synopses.Transponder: Started by clicking on the transponder in the back of the helm. Allows players to connect cables to end the tutorial.
session_synopses.AD_AmbushDevil: Leader of imps breaks through helm to attack mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_MindFlayerKillsPlayers: Cambion dies and mind flayer is still alive. He will kill the players.
session_synopses.PAD_MindFlayerFall: Player's comment about the mind flayer dying in battle with imps, if Lae'zel isn't there to do it.
session_synopses.AD_CambionTaunt_002: Combat AD for backup cambion taunting players while pursuing them
session_synopses.AD_CambionTaunt_001: Combat AD for backup cambion taunting players while pursuing them
session_synopses.MindflayerCall: The mind flayer in control of the nautiloid reaches out to the player, commanding them to restart the engine so the ship can escape Avernus. If the gith guide is present, the mind flayer will try to control the gith in the fight against the devils.
session_synopses.AD_GreaterDevil: Devil commander who continues to command/intimidate his troops in the battle against the mindflayer.
session_synopses.AD_ShadowheartRemindsNerves: As the player nears their final objective to escape the Nautiloid in the tutorial, Shadowheart calls out what they have to do - a transponder that needs to be reconnected at the front of the ship's helm
session_synopses.AD_BackUpCambion: Spoken by one of a  number of cambion reinforcements who storm the bridge of a nautiloid during a battle aboard the ship. Shouted battle orders to make haste. (note - this line is shared by a speaker group, though all possible speakers are male cambions - very minor characters only seen here in battle and never again).
session_synopses.PAD_FirstWarning: On the third turn of the helm fight, the player will comment on the ship heading for a crash.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerOutsideHelm: Oneliner PAD for when a player is away from the helm while another player has started the helm cinematic. The line warns that the situation is getting worse and going to the helm is a priority. This line will be acompanied with a camera shake.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelGoToHelmReminder: Players backtrack from the helm towards the upper deck. Lae'zel tells them to go back.
session_synopses.AD_DevilAfterDeadMindFlayer: Combat AD for Commander Zhaik when the mind flayer is killed, showing how he is now focusing his attention on the players
session_synopses.AD_CreatureCantUseTransponder: One liner narrator AD that gets trigger when a summon or Us is used to interact with the transponder. Doing so does nothing, while interacting with Avatars and Companions will start the scene that will transition into act 1, so it needs to be clear that the transponder has been interacted with the wrong creature.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRemindsNerves: Cambion and mind flayer dies, Lae'zel reminds us about the nerves.

PAD_Sign_001.speaker: Player
PAD_Sign_001.context: NodeContext: Player can decipher the meaning of the lever

PAD_PodStorage.speaker: Player
PAD_PodStorage.context: NodeContext: In awe and disgust. Each is for a victim like you.

DrainVictim000.speaker: Narrator
DrainVictim000.text: *The man isn't dead, but he's totally unresponsive.*

PAD_ControlPanel.speaker: Player
PAD_ControlPanel.text: Mind flayer machinery. Better watch what I touch.

PAD_ChairWhispers.speaker: Player
PAD_ChairWhispers.text: It's the chair - it's connected to the ship. And the ship's connected to the mind flayers.

PAD_ChairWhispers.speaker: Player
PAD_ChairWhispers.text: Let's go before they realise we're out of our pods.

ShadowheartFollower.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower.text: You're keen to chat, for someone in mortal peril. What's the matter?
ShadowheartFollower.context: NodeContext: Dry, slightly terse at being interrupted again (this is the second or subsequent time the player's stopped to talk while they're still in danger).

ShadowheartFollower.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower.text: Something the matter? Besides the obvious, that is.
ShadowheartFollower.context: NodeContext: 'the obvious' being that they're trying to escape a nautiloid flying through hell.

ShadowheartFollower.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFollower.text: Any suggestions for how to proceed?

ShadowheartFollower.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower.text: Well, jumping overboard is hardly an option - so that leaves us with taking control of this ship.
ShadowheartFollower.context: NodeContext: To the point and practical.

ShadowheartFollower.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartFollower.text: Provided we can figure out how to do that, of course...

AD_HostileUs.speaker: Us
AD_HostileUs.text: You are... not us. You must be terminated.

PodGirl.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl.text: You! Get me out of this damn thing!
PodGirl.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart is pounding from the inside of the pod. The pod itself is covered in strange lines of silver, unlike the other pods (this is qualith)NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. She tries to get the player to free her.

PodGirl.speaker: Shadowheart
PodGirl.text: What are you waiting for? Get this blasted tube open!
PodGirl.context: NodeContext: Urgrent, angry and desperate. She's locked in a coffin-sized tube aboard a crashing spaceship. There's seemingly no way to free her.

AD_AttackOnPod.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_AttackOnPod.text: Don't bother. You'll barely dent it.

PAD_PodLockUnactivated.speaker: Player
PAD_PodLockUnactivated.text: Whatever fits in that socket must power this thing.

AD_AltGuide_PodStorage.speaker: Losiir
AD_AltGuide_PodStorage.text: A pod for every victim. Disgusting.

PodLock.speaker: Narrator
PodLock.context: CinematicNodeContext: Console has' inactive' audiovisual cues

PodLock.speaker: Player
PodLock.text: Look for a switch or release.

PodLock.speaker: Narrator
PodLock.text: *The mechanisms are completely unrecognisable at first, but then you spy an empty socket.*
PodLock.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player peers at console, notices a socket (no need to show socket)

DrainVictim001.speaker: Narrator
DrainVictim001.text: *Life flickers in his eyes, but he seems totally unaware of his surroundings.*

AD_EmptySHPod.speaker: Narrator
AD_EmptySHPod.text: *Another pod, just like yours. How many more of these can there be?*

session_synopses.PAD_Sign_001: Started when passing an arcana check to discern the meaning of the sigil on the mind-draining machine above its respective lever. In this case it turns the mind slaves hostile.
session_synopses.PAD_PodStorage: If the gith guide is not present, player will comment on the mass mindflayer pod storage upon entering the room.
session_synopses.DrainVictim000: Player notices the victims are not responsive. Their minds have been drained.
session_synopses.PAD_ControlPanel: Player remarks on levers in a room. Not sure what the levers might initiate.
session_synopses.PAD_ChairWhispers: This AD triggers when players decide to sit on one of the chairs in the mindflayer room. The idea is that they hear voices from the nautiloid as if it was communciating with them.
session_synopses.PAD_FreedSlavesDead: The player tried to free some mindflayer thralls, but they're already dead
session_synopses.ShadowheartFollower: Shadowheart's default dialogue while she's following the player during the tutorial. They've only just met, but given the dangerous situation they're in, there isn't much time for chit-chat.
session_synopses.AD_HostileUs: AD oneliner for when after players have antagonized Us in the nautiloid and fled, He will appear in the mindflayer room with the other intellect devourer. When seeing players again, he will say this AD while entering combat.
session_synopses.AD_PodGirlCall: AD when the player goes near the pod containing Shadowheart while she struggles to get out.
session_synopses.PAD_PodKeyFound: The player finds a rune that was locked inside a chest on the nautiloid. They may or may not recognise that it fits in a socket in the inactive console next to Shadowheart's pod, located nearby in the same chamber.
session_synopses.PodGirl: Occurs if the player clicks on the first mind flayer pod with someone inside. They can attempt to free the captive - Shadowheart - but the magical runes guarding the pod prevent this.The player can leave her stuck, or try to find another way to free her. Via a skillcheck or via Shadowheart herself, they may receive a clue to examine the console next to the pod.
session_synopses.AD_AttackOnPod: One liner AD for Lae'zel if another player attempts to hit a pod in the Nautiloid
session_synopses.AD_LaezelLeverResponse: Lae'zel tells you off for pulling a dangerous lever on a mind flayer machine.
session_synopses.AD_PatrollingIntDev: AD when interacting with the intellect devourer that is patrolling between the mindflayer room where a human is in a pod and can be transformed into an illithid and the room where two other thralls are in chairs and can be killed or turned hostile by pressing buttons.The intellect devourer will recognize players as kin because of the tadpole, and without revealing too much mention how tadpoled people are being experimented on and turned into mindflayers.
session_synopses.PAD_PodLockUnactivated: The player interacts with an inactive console near Shadowheart's pod aboard the nautiloid, and notices a socket of sorts.
session_synopses.PAD_SlavesHostile: When pulling the aggression lever on the mind draining device, the player observes the machine made them hostile.
session_synopses.AD_AltGuide_PodStorage: reaction to seeing the mass pod storage room.
session_synopses.PAD_TransformationFinished: PAD for when players interact with obstacles that prevent them from reaching Path of Hell, the outside area in the Nautiloid in tutorial.
session_synopses.PAD_ChestLocked: Started when trying to open the reliquary without the key.
session_synopses.PodLock: The player interacts with a console that can be used to free Shadowheart from her pod. In order to use it correctly, they must first insert an activation rune (or be a magic user who passed an earlier arcana check that provided a clue about the console), then psionically connect with the console and command it to open the pod.
session_synopses.DrainVictim001: Player looks at unresponsive mind-drained victim.
session_synopses.AD_EmptySHPod: Narrator AD if players interact with the empty pod where Shadowheart would have been if she was an NPC instead of an Avatar. It should be a generic comment concerning pods and the situation players find themselves in the nautiloid.

PAD_FoundInfernalMetal.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundInfernalMetal.text: Hm. Wonder if that's of any use.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundInfernalMetal: Player exclaims they might be able to find a use for the infernal metal somewhere later (this will get paid off in Act 2 with Dammon, the tiefling weaponsmith)
